item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, September 18, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Is Tor still safe to use? (153 points | 60 comments)
2. Why wordfreq will not be updated (1072 points | 332 comments)
3. Moshi: A speech-text foundation model for real time dialogue (108 points | 15 comments)
4. Qwen2.5: A Party of Foundation Models (70 points | 11 comments)
5. 0day Contest for End-of-Life Devices Announced (150 points | 78 comments)
6. Microplastics in the Olfactory Bulb of the Human Brain (51 points | 19 comments)
7. Bento: Jupyter Notebooks at Meta (120 points | 53 comments)
8. OpenAI Threatening to Ban Users for Asking Strawberry About Its Reasoning (122 points | 64 comments)
9. A high-performance, zero-overhead, extensible Python compiler using LLVM (103 points | 21 comments)
10. Llama 3.1 Omni Model (45 points | 1 comment)
11. Show HN: I made crowdwave – imagine Twitter/Reddit but every post is a voicemail (26 points | 10 comments)
12. Holding a Program in One's Head (2007) (45 points | 25 comments)
13. RabbitMQ 4.0 Released (148 points | 48 comments)
14. Meta AI: "The Future of AI Is Open Source and Decentralized" (96 points | 53 comments)
15. The Dune Shell (129 points | 40 comments)
16. Gentle Guide to Self-Hosting (196 points | 81 comments)
17. OpenTelemetry and vendor neutrality: how to build an observability strategy (10 points | 1 comment)
18. Launch HN: Cerebrium (YC W22) – Serverless Infrastructure Platform for ML/AI (34 points | 19 comments)
19. Apple mobile processors are now made in America by TSMC (1386 points | 677 comments)
20. Senate Vote Tomorrow Could Give Helping Hand to Patent Trolls (89 points | 16 comments)
21. Papermill: Parameterizing, executing, and analyzing Jupyter Notebooks (73 points | 53 comments)
22. Scramble: Open-Source Alternative to Grammarly (381 points | 153 comments)
23. Twitter shut off API access; users volunteering their own data for an open API (95 points | 64 comments)
24. GM electric vehicles can now access Tesla Superchargers (67 points | 36 comments)
25. Knowledge graphs using Ollama and Embeddings to answer and visualizing queries (61 points | 6 comments)
26. Show HN: GitNotebooks - Jupyter Notebook Review Tool (6 points | discuss)
27. Valkey 8.0.0 Is Out (75 points | 24 comments)
28. Putting Code on a Nerves Device (25 points | discuss)
29. CUNY paid Oracle $600M for its HR software (2013) (246 points | 172 comments)
30. Show HN: Sol – A de-minifier for shell programs (118 points | 22 comments)
